intro: Allophylus katangensis, commonly known as the Katanga alder, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in panicles, followed by woody, capsule-like fruits containing several seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests.
